text: (mellow upbeat music)
- AMS stands for AWS Managed Services.

We're here to partner
with our customers on AWS.
- We provide infrastructure management
to external customers.

- We help enterprises
adopt the cloud at scale

for their critical
production applications.
- So that they can focus on innovation

and we can focus on their
operations for them.

- [Rashmi] This is the best
environment for new people.

You can come experiment,
learn, ask a lot of questions.
- Being the managed services,

you pretty much cover
all aspects of the cloud.
You learn everything about the cloud.

- It's a place where you can
show up every day and create.
- The reason why I think AMS is special

is because we provide operational
services across the board

with all the AWS services
for our customers.
So you really get exposed to

everything that's great
about AWS in one place.

- I always knew AWS is a
fairly fast-paced place.
But the amount of scope of work it covers,

and the amount of project
we have, it's just amazing.
- Working at a pace that Amazon is,

my skillset has been,
like, improving hundred X

compared to what I would
have at other companies.
- Something that has really struck me

since I've been working
here is the people.

- I knew that people were
gonna be incredibly smart,
and I was wrong.
They were like, amazingly, smart.
(laugh) Even smarter than I expected.
- This is, like, purely from my heart.

I absolutely love the
people that I work with.
I cannot stress enough.

They're inspiring, very
dedicated, passionate.
- It really is incredible

the people that I get
to work with every day.

- The most motivating thing
for me about staying at AWS
is the, like, laser sharp focus
on working backwards from the customer.
- We are working with the most innovative,
exciting companies in the world.

As they innovate on behalf
of their organizations
and their customers,
we get to solve the hard problems

with incredibly innovative
solutions every single day.
(upbeat music)
